member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context
member.summary: Provides members for setting and retrieving data about Revit application context.

member.name: P:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.UiApplication
member.summary: Represents an active session of the Autodesk Revit user interface, providing access to UI customization methods, events, the main window, and the active document.

member.name: P:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.UiControlledApplication
member.summary: Represents the Autodesk Revit user interface, providing access to UI customization methods and events.

member.name: P:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.Application
member.summary: Represents the database level Autodesk Revit Application, providing access to documents, options and other application wide data and settings.

member.name: P:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.ActiveUiDocument
member.summary: Represents a currently active Autodesk Revit project at the UI level.
member.remarks: External API commands can access this property in read-only mode only.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to modify the property.
member.returns:
Currently active project.
Returns if there are no active projects.

member.name: P:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.UiDocument
member.summary: Represents a currently active Autodesk Revit project at the UI level.

member.name: P:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.ActiveDocument
member.summary: Represents a currently active Autodesk Revit project at the database level.
member.remarks:
Revit can have multiple projects open and multiple views to those projects. The active or top most view will be the active project and hence the active document which is available from the Application object.
Returns if there are no active projects.

member.name: P:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.Document
member.summary: Represents a currently active Autodesk Revit project at the database level.

member.name: P:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.ActiveView
member.summary: Represents the currently active view of the currently active document.

remarks.para:
This property is applicable to the currently active document only.
Returns if there are no active projects.

The active view can only be changed when:
There is no open transaction.
is false.
is false.
ViewActivating, ViewActivated, and any pre-action of events (such as DocumentSaving or DocumentClosing events) are not being handled.

member.exception: When setting the property: If the 'view' argument is NULL.

When setting the property:
If the given view is not a valid view of the document; -or-
If the given view is a template view; -or-
If the given view is an internal view.

exception.para:
When setting the property:
If the document is not currently active; -or-
If the document is currently modifiable (i.e. with an active transaction); -or-
If the document is currently in read-only state; -or-
When invoked during either ViewActivating or ViewActivated event; -or-
When invoked during any pre-action kind of event, such as DocumentSaving, DocumentClosing, etc.
When there are no active documents in the current Autodesk Revit session

member.name: P:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.ActiveGraphicalView
member.summary: Represents the currently active graphical view of the currently active document.
member.remarks: This property is applicable to the currently active document only. Returns if there are no active projects.

member.name: P:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.IsRevitInApiMode
member.summary: Determines whether Revit is in API mode or not.
member.remarks: If Revit is within an API context, direct API calls should be used. Otherwise, when Revit is outside the API context, API calls should be handled through the interface. IExternalEventHandler enables safely executing commands and operations from external threads or the user interface, ensuring they are synchronized with Revit's main thread.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.SuppressFailures(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Suppresses the display of the Revit error and warning messages during transaction.
member.param: Set if errors should be automatically resolved, otherwise to cancel the transaction.
member.remarks: By default, Revit uses manual error resolution control with user interaction. This method provides automatic resolution of all failures without notifying the user or interrupting the program.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.SuppressDialogs(System.Int32)
member.summary: Suppresses the display of the Revit dialogs.
member.param: The result code you wish the Revit dialog to return.
member.remarks:
The range of valid result values depends on the type of dialog as follows:
DialogBox: Any non-zero value will cause a dialog to be dismissed.
MessageBox: Standard Message Box IDs, such as IDOK and IDCANCEL, are accepted. For all possible IDs, refer to the Windows API documentation. The ID used must be relevant to the buttons in a message box.
TaskDialog: Standard Message Box IDs and Revit Custom IDs are accepted, depending on the buttons used in a dialog. Standard buttons, such as OK and Cancel, have standard IDs described in Windows API documentation. Buttons with custom text have custom IDs with incremental values starting at 1001 for the left-most or top-most button in a task dialog.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.SuppressDialogs(System.Action{Autodesk.Revit.UI.Events.DialogBoxShowingEventArgs})
member.summary: Suppresses the display of the Revit dialogs.
member.param: Suppress handler.
member.remarks:
The range of valid result values depends on the type of dialog as follows:
DialogBox: Any non-zero value will cause a dialog to be dismissed.
MessageBox: Standard Message Box IDs, such as IDOK and IDCANCEL, are accepted. For all possible IDs, refer to the Windows API documentation. The ID used must be relevant to the buttons in a message box.
TaskDialog: Standard Message Box IDs and Revit Custom IDs are accepted, depending on the buttons used in a dialog. Standard buttons, such as OK and Cancel, have standard IDs described in Windows API documentation. Buttons with custom text have custom IDs with incremental values starting at 1001 for the left-most or top-most button in a task dialog.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.RestoreDialogs
member.summary: Restores display of the Revit dialogs.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Context.RestoreFailures
member.summary: Restores failure handling.

member.summary: Interface that the Revit UI will call during initialization of the user interface to gather information about add-in dockable pane windows.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Decorators.IDockablePaneProviderConfiguration.SetConfiguration(System.Action{Autodesk.Revit.UI.DockablePaneProviderData})
member.summary: Sets the configuration of the dockable pane.
member.param: Configuration handler. Provides a container for information about the new dockable pane. Implementers should set the FrameworkElement and InitialState Properties. Optionally, providers can set the ContextualHelp property if they wish to provide or react to help requests on the pane, or override the default EditorInteraction property by setting it here.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.ExternalApplication
member.summary: Class that supports addition of external applications to Revit. Is the entry point when loading an external application.
member.remarks: External applications are permitted to customize the Revit UI, and to add events and updaters to the session.

member.summary: Indicates if the external application completes its work successfully.
member.remarks: Method will not be executed if the value of this property is different from .

member.summary: Overload this method to execute some tasks when Revit shuts down.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.ExternalEventHandler
member.summary: External event used to change the document.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.ExternalEventHandler.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of external event.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.ExternalEventHandler.Execute(Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIApplication)
member.summary: This method is called to handle the external event.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.ExternalEventHandler.GetName
member.summary: String identification of the event handler.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.ExternalEventHandler.Raise
member.summary: Instructing Revit to raise (signal) the external event.
member.remarks: Revit will wait until it is ready to process the event and then it will execute its event handler by calling the Execute method. Revit processes external events only when no other commands or edit modes are currently active in Revit, which is the same policy like the one that applies to evoking external commands.
member.returns: The result of event raising request. If the request is 'Accepted', the event would be added to the event queue and its handler will be executed in the next event-processing cycle.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.ActionEventHandler
member.summary: Handler, to provide access to modify the Revit document with the ability to queue calls to Raise methods.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.ActionEventHandler.Execute(Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIApplication)
member.summary: Callback invoked by Revit. Not used to be called in user code.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.ActionEventHandler.Raise(System.Action{Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIApplication})
member.summary: Instructing Revit to queue a handler and raise (signal) the external event.
member.remarks:
Revit will wait until it is ready to process the event and then it will execute its event handler by calling the Execute method. Revit processes external events only when no other commands or edit modes are currently active in Revit, which is the same policy like the one that applies to evoking external commands.
Executes the handler out of queue if Revit is in API mode.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.ActionEventHandler.Cancel
member.summary: Clears the call queue of subscribed delegates.
member.remarks: The queue can be cleaned up before the first delegate is invoked.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.AsyncEventHandler
member.summary: Handler, to provide access to modify the Revit document.
member.remarks: Suitable for cases where it is needed to await the completion of an external event.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.AsyncEventHandler.Execute(Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIApplication)
member.summary: Callback invoked by Revit. Not used to be called in user code.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.AsyncEventHandler.RaiseAsync(System.Action{Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIApplication})
member.summary: Instructing Revit to queue a handler, raise (signal) the external event and async awaiting for its completion.
member.remarks:
This method async awaiting completion of the method.
Exceptions in the delegate will not be ignored and will be rethrown in the original synchronization context.
, will cause a deadlock.
Executes the handler out of queue if Revit is in API mode.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.AsyncEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handler, to provide access to modify the Revit document.
member.remarks: Suitable for cases where it is needed to await the completion of an external event with the return of a value.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.AsyncEventHandler`1.Execute(Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIApplication)
member.summary: This method is called to handle the external event.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.AsyncEventHandler`1.RaiseAsync(System.Func{Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIApplication,`0})
member.summary: Instructing Revit to queue a handler, raise (signal) the external event and async awaiting for its completion.
member.returns: The return value of the method that delegate encapsulates.
member.remarks:
This method async awaiting completion of the method.
Exceptions in the delegate will not be ignored and will be rethrown in the original synchronization context.
, will cause a deadlock.
Executes the handler out of queue if Revit is in API mode.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.IdlingEventHandler
member.summary:
Handler, to provide access to modify the Revit document with the ability to queue calls to Raise methods.
Delegates will be invoked when UIApplication.Idling occurs
member.remarks:
Unsubscribing from the Idling event occurs immediately.
Suitable for cases where you need to call code when Revit receives focus or to open a dialog after loading a family into the project.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.IdlingEventHandler.Execute(Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIApplication)
member.summary: Callback invoked by Revit. Not used to be called in user code.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.IdlingEventHandler.Raise(System.Action{Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIApplication})
member.summary: Instructing Revit to queue a handler and raise (signal) the external event.
member.remarks: Revit will wait until it is ready to process the event and then it will execute its event handler by calling the Execute method. Revit processes external events only when no other commands or edit modes are currently active in Revit, which is the same policy like the one that applies to evoking external commands.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.External.Handlers.IdlingEventHandler.Cancel
member.summary: Clears the call queue of subscribed delegates.
member.remarks: The queue can be cleaned up before the first delegate is invoked.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Helpers.ResolveHelper
member.summary: Provides methods to resolve dependencies.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Helpers.ResolveHelper.BeginAssemblyResolve``1
member.summary: Subscribes the current domain to resolve dependencies for the type.
member.typeparam: Type, to search for dependencies in the directory where this type is defined.
member.remarks: Dependencies are searched in a directory of the specified type. At the time of dependency resolution, all other dependency resolution methods for the domain are disabled, this requires calling immediately after executing user code where dependency failures occur.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Helpers.ResolveHelper.BeginAssemblyResolve(System.Type)
member.summary: Subscribes the current domain to resolve dependencies for the type module.
member.param: Type, to search for dependencies in the directory where this type is defined.
member.remarks: Dependencies are searched in a directory of the specified type. At the time of dependency resolution, all other dependency resolution methods for the domain are set to low priority, this requires calling immediately after executing user code to avoid conflict with Revit runtime.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Helpers.ResolveHelper.EndAssemblyResolve
member.summary: Unsubscribes the current domain to resolve dependencies for the type module.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.DuplicateTypeNamesHandler
member.summary: A class for custom handlers of duplicate type names encountered during a paste operation. When the destination document contains types that have the same names as the types being copied, but different internals, a decision must be made on how to proceed - whether to cancel the operation or continue, but only copy types with unique names.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.DuplicateTypeNamesHandler.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new handler with by default.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.DuplicateTypeNamesHandler.#ctor(Autodesk.Revit.DB.DuplicateTypeAction)
member.summary: Creates a new handler.
member.param: A structure that provides information about an attempt to copy types with names that already exist in the destination document.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.DuplicateTypeNamesHandler.#ctor(System.Func{Autodesk.Revit.DB.DuplicateTypeNamesHandlerArgs,Autodesk.Revit.DB.DuplicateTypeAction})
member.summary: Creates a new handler.
member.param: Encapsulates a method on a structure that provides information about an attempt to copy types with names that already exist in the destination document.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.DuplicateTypeNamesHandler.OnDuplicateTypeNamesFound(Autodesk.Revit.DB.DuplicateTypeNamesHandlerArgs)
member.summary: Called when the destination document contains types with the same names as the types being copied.
member.param: The information about the types with duplicate names.
member.returns: The action to be taken: copy only types with unique names or cancel the operation.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.FamilyLoadOptions
member.summary: A class which provide the callback for family load options.

example.code: document.LoadFamily(fileName, new FamilyLoadOptions(), out var family); document.LoadFamily(fileName, UIDocument.GetRevitUIFamilyLoadOptions(), out var family);

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.FamilyLoadOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Return the option object that allows families to be loaded.
member.remarks: Overwrites parameter values of existing types.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.FamilyLoadOptions.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return the option object that allows families to be loaded.
member.param: This determines whether or not to overwrite the parameter values of existing types.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.FamilyLoadOptions.#ctor(System.Boolean,Autodesk.Revit.DB.FamilySource)
member.summary: Return the option object that allows families to be loaded.
member.param: This determines whether or not to overwrite the parameter values of existing types.
This indicates if the family will load from the project or the current family.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.FamilyLoadOptions.OnFamilyFound(System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: A method called when the family was found in the target document.
member.remarks: Triggered only when the family is both loaded and changed.
member.param: Indicates if one or more instances of the family is placed in the project.
This determines whether or not to overwrite the parameter values of existing types. The default value is false.
member.returns: Return true to continue loading the family, false to cancel.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.FamilyLoadOptions.OnSharedFamilyFound(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Family,System.Boolean,Autodesk.Revit.DB.FamilySource@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: A method called when the shared family was found in the target document.
member.remarks: Triggered only when the family is both loaded and changed.
member.param: The shared family in the current family document.
Indicates if one or more instances of the family is placed in the project.
This indicates if the family will load from the project or the current family.
This indicates whether or not to overwrite the parameter values of existing types.
member.returns: Return true to continue loading the family, false to cancel.

Selection handler.
Element – A candidate element in selection operation.
member.returns: Return true to allow the user to select this candidate element. Return false to prevent selection of this element.
member.remarks:
If prompting the user to select an element from a Revit Link instance, the element passed here will be the link instance, not the selected linked element.
If an exception is thrown from this method, the element will not be permitted to be selected.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Options.ISelectionFilterConfiguration.Reference(System.Func{Autodesk.Revit.DB.Reference,Autodesk.Revit.DB.XYZ,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Handler indicating if the element should be permitted to be selected.
member.param:
Selection handler.
Reference – A candidate reference in selection operation.
position – The 3D position of the mouse on the candidate reference.
member.returns:
Return true to allow the user to select this candidate reference. Return false to prevent selection of this candidate.
If an exception is thrown from this method, the element will not be permitted to be selected.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Utils.FailureUtils
member.summary: Provides utils for processing failures.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Utils.FailureUtils.ResolveFailures(Autodesk.Revit.DB.FailuresAccessor)
member.summary: Automatically processes failure messages during transaction flow by resolving or deleting them, eliminating the need for manual intervention.
member.param: An object that provides access to the failure messages and their handling options.
member.returns: Returns if all failures are resolved or deleted, otherwise returns .
member.remarks: Warnings are automatically deleted, and failures with available resolutions are resolved.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Toolkit.Utils.FailureUtils.DismissFailures(Autodesk.Revit.DB.FailuresAccessor)
member.summary: Automatically processes failure messages during transaction flow by cancelling all them, eliminating the need for manual intervention.
member.param: An object that provides access to the failure messages and their handling options.
member.returns: Returns if the failuresAccessor has any message/>.
